question: Yolk sac is seen earliest at what stage of gestational age-
exp: Ans. is 4a' i. e., 5[?]5 weeks o Using transvaginal sonography, yolk sac always visible at 5[?]5 weeks gestational age. (when mean sac diameter- 5 - 8 mm). o Using transabdominal approach, yolk sac should be evident by 7 weeks gestation, when mean sac diameter is 20 mmo Cardiac activity should be detected at 6 - 6-5 weeks gestation by TVS and 8 weeks by using TAS.

question: Fetal cardiac activity is detected with Trans vaginal USG as early as?
exp: ANSWER: (A) 6weeks. REF: USG in Obstetrics & Gynecology by Callen 4ch edition page 119-120. Fetal cardiac activity is detected as early as. With Transvaginal USG6 weeks of gestational age. With Transabdominal USG8 weeks of gestational age
